title: WARN: eslint-config-airbnb@15.0.1 requires a peer of eslint@^3.19.0 but none was installed.
body:
Hi,

With all dependencies updated, I get the following warning:

`npm WARN eslint-config-airbnb@15.0.1 requires a peer of eslint@^3.19.0 but none was installed.`

package json: 

```
{
  "name": "grapql-server",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "",
  "scripts": {
    "start": "nodemon ./server.js --exec babel-node"
  },
  "author": "",
  "license": "ISC",
  "dependencies": {
    "body-parser": "^1.15.2",
    "cors": "^2.8.0",
    "express": "4.15.3",
    "graphql": "^0.10.0",
    "graphql-tools": "^1.1.0",
    "express-graphql": "^0.6.1",
    "lodash": "^4.15.0",
    "multer": "^1.2.1",
    "mysql": "^2.12.0",
    "nodemailer": "^4.0.1",
    "request": "^2.81.0",
    "sequelize": "^4.2.1",
    "socket.io": "^2.0.3"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "babel-cli": "6.24.1",
    "babel-core": "^6.17.0",
    "babel-eslint": "^7.0.0",
    "babel-plugin-inline-import": "^2.0.1",
    "babel-polyfill": "6.23.0",
    "babel-preset-es2015": "6.24.1",
    "babel-preset-react": "^6.5.0",
    "babel-preset-stage-0": "6.24.1",
    "eslint": "^4.1.1",
    "eslint-config-airbnb": "^15.0.1",
    "eslint-plugin-import": "^2.0.1",
    "eslint-plugin-react": "^7.1.0",
    "nodemon": "^1.9.1"
  },
  "eslintConfig": {
    "parser": "babel-eslint",
    "extends": [
      "airbnb/base",
      "plugin:import/errors"
    ],
    "rules": {
      "no-use-before-define": 0,
      "arrow-body-style": 0,
      "dot-notation": 0,
      "no-console": 0
    },
    "env": {
      "mocha": true
    }
  }
}
```

Could please someone tell me why, or how to fix it?
Thanks!

title: [eslint config] Prohibit global isNaN, isFinite
body: Fixes https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/issues/1347.

title: Why does eslint-config-airbnb-base set env:node?
body:
Pardon me if this has been discussed already (couldn't find much). 

Building on [this issue](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/issues/1002#issuecomment-238062892), should eslint-config-airbnb-base be [setting the node environment](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/master/packages/eslint-config-airbnb-base/index.js#L5)? Should this also be left to apps to configure? Maybe this was done for some historical/migration reasons?

title: [eslint config][base][minor] add array-*-newline regarding to docs
body:
Follow PR of #1339. There are now 2 rules `array-bracket-newline` and `array-element-newline` which satisfies together the rule [4.6](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript#arrays--bracket-newline).

These rules are available since Eslint v4.0.0, so this PR should wait until Eslint v4 is supported by this styleguide (ref #1447).

title: `jsx-a11y/href-no-hash` removal
body: Hello. [`jsx-a11y/href-no-hash` has been removed/renamed a few days ago](https://github.com/evcohen/eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y/commit/a14617528cda23c6c88902ace1d083e4e13ac271), and [your rule](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/2666db559dc0ef41887a1138cff4f59b3879892a/packages/eslint-config-airbnb/rules/react-a11y.js#L37) is now raising errors

title: Conflicting rule: Comparison Operators & Equality
body:
https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/master/README.md#comparison--eqeqeq

It can be read like to completely prohibite == and !=, but linter accept it.
https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/57ff032b0740ba2a46af4bc40cf5638a3e62a365/packages/eslint-config-airbnb-base/rules/best-practices.js#L40

Which do you recommend?
```if (object == null) { ... }``` or ```if (!object) { ... }```

title: Typo: Missing eslint-config-airbnb for yarn
body: Missing `eslint-config-airbnb` will result in an error: cannot find module.

title: Align JavaScript style guide with Newsela's style preferences.
body:
This includes things like:

1. Not allowing spaces between curly braces
2. Newsela-specific import order
3. Using `_.size` and lodash methods in general over `.length` and inbuilt JavaScript methods.
4. A caveat for wildcard exports for Redux.

title: Add documentation for ES7's new exponentiation operator
body:
### Summary

1. Add documentation for ES7's new exponentiation operator.
1. Also changed `es6` to `es6+` in few places.

-----
Related discussion: https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/issues

title: Broken links
body:
In http://airbnb.io/javascript/ 
The links to the guides http://airbnb.io/javascript/react/ and http://airbnb.io/javascript/css-in-javascript/ are broken

title: Fix typo in a11y for yarn
Add a quick line for yarn support
Add installation instructions for yarn
body:
`yarn info "eslint-config-airbnb@latest" peerDependencies` returns undefined.

I used `yarn add --dev eslint-config-airbnb-base eslint-plugin-import`.

title: (comma-dangle) is a false positive in a arrow function predicate
body:
The line in the filter is an example and actual implementations might vary.

This produces an error in the line (max-len) which is reasonable
```js
const fruits = ['apples', 'oranges', 'bananas', 'pears']
  .filter(veryLongFruitVariableNameForExample => veryLongFruitVariableNameForExample === 'oranges' ||  veryLongFruitVariableNameForExample === 'pears'  );  // Error (max-len) here
```
This produces a (coma-dangle) in the multiline conditional which is wrong.
```js
const fruits = ['apples', 'oranges', 'bananas', 'pears']
  .filter(veryLongFruitVariableNameForExample => veryLongFruitVariableNameForExample === 'oranges' ||  
   veryLongFruitVariableNameForExample === 'pears'  // <---- coma-dangle error here
);
```

title: Add missing close parenthesis to section 8.2
No compatible version found: eslint-plugin-react@^#.#.#
body:
I am on Ubuntu 16.04, and it has been a mission trying to configure airbnb styling guide with eslint. 
Initially, I was trying to install eslint-config-airbnb, `npm i -S eslint-config-airbnb` but I kept getting a 

```
npm WARN optional Skipping failed optional dependency /chokidar/fsevents:
npm WARN notsup Not compatible with your operating system or architecture: fsevents@1.1.2

```

I even looked at [this guys thing that had the same problem](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/issues/465) but it didn't help. 

I have not used eslint before, so to be 100% honest, I don't know when or why to run `eslint app`

title: replacing undefined with ReferenceError
body:
Accessing the variable outside the function would throw an Uncaught ReferenceError.

Fixes #1457

title: Chaining variable assignments Example
Support Protractor config files in import/no-extraneous-dependencies
body: Protractor is used to run E2E tests and therefore is considered to be a dev dependency. We should be able to import dev dependencies inside Protractor config files (`protractor.conf.*.js`).

title: Fix iterator code example error
body: The first "good" example was missing a closing bracket (line 1377).

title: [eslint-config-airbnb] Unexpected top-level property "ecmaFeatures".
body:
Hi,

I've been trying to install version 15.0.1, but I'm encountering the following error:

    ESLint configuration is invalid:
    	- Unexpected top-level property "ecmaFeatures".
    
    Referenced from: airbnb
    Referenced from: /app/.eslintrc Error: /app/node_modules/eslint-config-airbnb/rules/react-a11y.js:
    	ESLint configuration is invalid:
    	- Unexpected top-level property "ecmaFeatures".

I saw that arount one month ago a fix was released in the master channel, but no new version has been made available on npm/yarn.

Is there a way to pull the git repo directly? I don't know how to specify the subdirectory of the javascript project.

Thanks

title: Fe 1002 reducers component exports
body: Cleaning up the styles to better represent out default export rules.

title: Remove TODO in prefer-reflect as it's deprecated
body:
Fixes #1451 

From eslint v3.9.0 this option is deprecated, so removing TODO comment questioning enablement.

title: prefer-reflect is deprecated
Updated "how to define propTypes..."
